body: After stealing all those chunky pinky rings and diamond-studded watches, Michael McLean might have realized that the cat burglary business had led him into dangerous territory. For nearly four years, Mr. McLean and his partner, Robert Mede, ran an unusually successful break-in ring, sneaking into 14 homes in Brooklyn and the affluent Todt Hill
title: Brazen Thieves Hit Mobsters' Homes, And Dons Don't See the Humor in It

body: WHEN she first arrived from the Soviet Union seven years ago, Natalya Novikova cleaned other people's homes. Now she is president of a travel agency and owns her own $244,000 home in Brooklyn -- purchased with a mortgage that offers flexibility for even higher steps on America's ladder to success. It was Mrs. Novikova who supported the family
title: Fitting the Mortgage to the Need

body: THEY are often called ''white bricks'' or, simply, ''plain vanilla'' -- the flat-fronted apartment houses built in the 50's and 60's and early 70's on most major residential thoroughfares in Manhattan. They are what the apartment seeker may think of as simply ''postwar'' -- despite the fact that the condominium towers erected in the 80's and 90's
title: A New Taste for Postwar Co-ops

body: In the following reports, the "listed at" price is the asking price when negotiations began that ended in the sale. Time on market is from most recent listing to contract. MANHATTAN BATTERY PARK CITY $225,000 300 Rector Place (Battery Pointe) 2-bedroom, 2-bath, 1,010-sq.-ft. condo in a 9-year-old building; 24-hr. concierge, exercise room, sun deck;
title: Residential Resales
